title: Tab Completion Practice
description: An interactive simulation that lets students practice using tab completion in a simulated terminal environment with three progressive difficulty levels.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Linux
Terminal
Shell
Command Line

learningObjectives: Apply tab completion to efficiently navigate directories
Understand how tab completion handles single vs. multiple matches
Practice using tab completion with paths and filenames
prerequisites: Basic understanding of files and directories

controls.name: Tab key
controls.description: Triggers tab completion in the simulated terminal

controls.name: Reset
controls.description: Resets the current level to start over

controls.name: Next Challenge
controls.description: Advances to the next difficulty level

limitations: Does not simulate all real terminal behaviors
